library(matlib)
library(knitr)
# Version 2
## Example 6

### The matrix to be solved:
A <- matrix(
        c( 0,-2, 2,-1,
           1, 2,-2, 1,
           2,-1, 0, 1,
          -2, 0, 1,-1), 4, 4, byrow = TRUE)
b <- c(-1, 2, 4,-4)

#### Show (in Latex)
showEqn(A, b, fractions = TRUE, latex = TRUE)

$$
\begin{array}{lllllllll}
 0 \cdot x_1 &-& 2 \cdot x_2 &+& 2 \cdot x_3 &-& 1 \cdot x_4  &=&  -1 \\ 
 1 \cdot x_1 &+& 2 \cdot x_2 &-& 2 \cdot x_3 &+& 1 \cdot x_4  &=&   2 \\ 
 2 \cdot x_1 &-& 1 \cdot x_2 &+& 0 \cdot x_3 &+& 1 \cdot x_4  &=&   4 \\ 
-2 \cdot x_1 &+& 0 \cdot x_2 &+& 1 \cdot x_3 &-& 1 \cdot x_4  &=&  -4 \\ 
\end{array}
$$


### Ab1
Ab <- matrix(c( -1,-2, 2,-1,
                 2, 2,-2, 1,
                 4,-1, 0, 1,
                -4, 0, 1,-1), 4, 4, byrow = TRUE)


Det(Ab, verbose = TRUE, fractions = TRUE)
```r
det = (-1)^1 x 4 x 5/2 x 1/5 x 1/2 = -1
```

### Ab2
Ab2 <- matrix(
        c( 0,-1, 2,-1,
           1, 2,-2, 1,
           2, 4, 0, 1,
          -2,-4, 1,-1), 4, 4, byrow = TRUE)


Det(Ab2, verbose = TRUE, fractions = TRUE)
```r
det = (-1)^1 x 2 x 5/2 x -1 x 1/5 = 1
```

## Example 2

### Inverse of A:
A <- matrix(c(2,-2, 1,
              1,-1, 1,
             -5, 6,-4), 3, 3, byrow=TRUE)

Aminus <- Inverse(A)

Au <- A %*% c(3,2,2)

B <- matrix(c( 2, 0, 2,
              -1, 2, 0,
               3, 3, 2), 3, 3, byrow=TRUE)

Bv <- B %*% c(2, 0, 1)

result = Aminus %*% (Au + Bv)
result
